name: Ashley Schuliger
nameDescription: A play on her last name and the concept of 'shell code' used to break into secure Matrix nodes.
backstory: Schuliger-Shell is the Red Team's primary infiltrator, writing the scripts that crack the outer shell of machine outposts before the team makes their move.

name: Michael Prete
nameDescription: Phonetic play on 'pre-code', the raw data before it’s compiled into the simulation.
backstory: Prete-Code analyzes the raw stream of the Matrix, spotting vulnerabilities in the environment's physics before they even render.

name: Sam Schantz
nameDescription: Linking his name directly to the last human city.
backstory: A true believer in the cause, Sam-Zion coordinates the logistics between the hovercraft and the dock workers in the city's core.

name: Ryan Shendler
nameDescription: Referencing the 'Red Line' of a hovercraft's engine and the color of the team.
backstory: As the lead engineer, Ryan Red-Line pushes the ship's engines to the absolute limit to outrun Sentinel swarms in the tunnels.

name: Adam Wilson-Hwang
nameDescription: A title given to those brave enough to engage upgraded programs.
backstory: Adam specializes in distraction tactics, using high-impact maneuvers to draw Agent attention away from the team's exit strategy.

name: Albert Hernandez
nameDescription: A play on 'Albert' and the 1s and 0s of machine language.
backstory: Al-Binary speaks the language of the machines, often tricking automated gates into thinking the Red Team's ship is just a maintenance drone.

name: Alex Kelly
nameDescription: Direct reference to the program that can open any door in the Matrix.
backstory: If there is a locked file or a hidden corridor, Alex Keymaker finds the shortcut. He holds the digital skeleton keys to the city.

name: Alex Nikolis
nameDescription: Combining his name with Neo, the protagonist.
backstory: Alex Neo-lis is known for his incredible reflexes during combat training, often moving faster than the training programs can track.

name: Anthony Conway
nameDescription: A play on his last name and the 'convoy' missions led by Captain Niobe.
backstory: The master of the transport, Anthony Convoy ensures that all 'Red Pill' recruits are safely ferried from their extraction point to the ship.

name: Austin Gage
nameDescription: Punning 'Gage' with 'Gateway', the entry point into the system.
backstory: Austin monitors the gateways between the Real World and the Matrix, ensuring no data leaks follow the team back to the ship.

name: Awad Khawaja
nameDescription: Mixing his last name with the foundation of the Matrix: Code.
backstory: Code-waja writes the custom combat subroutines that give the Red Team an edge in hand-to-hand combat against system enforcers.

name: Ben Sadick
nameDescription: Rhyming his last name with the 'Static' of a disrupted signal.
backstory: Ben Static is a master of electronic warfare, deploying signal jammers that turn Sentinel sensors into useless noise.

name: Brian France
nameDescription: Referencing Morpheus’s goal: 'Free your mind.'
backstory: Brian leads the Red Team's philosophy, helping new recruits break through the mental barriers of the simulation's rules.

name: Bryan Sambrook
nameDescription: Playing on his last name and 'The Source', the machine mainframe.
backstory: Bryan maps the deep architecture of the Source, looking for the one path that could lead to a system-wide shutdown.

name: Chara Meidani
nameDescription: A pun on 'Character' and her first name.
backstory: Chara-cter Code designs the 'digital self' avatars for the team, making sure they look and move naturally enough to avoid detection.

name: Charles Clarke
nameDescription: Alliteration referencing the speed of a processor.
backstory: Charles Clock-Speed is the team's overclocking specialist, squeezing every bit of performance out of the ship's ancient hardware.

name: Chelsea Merrill
nameDescription: Referencing the powerful info-broker program.
backstory: Chelsea handles the Red Team's 'gray market' connections, trading data with exiles to get the team the supplies they need.

name: Colin Walsh
nameDescription: Punning his last name with 'Firewall'.
backstory: The ultimate defensive specialist, Colin Fire-Walsh builds layers of protection around the ship's signal during high-risk hacks.

name: Dan Byrnes
nameDescription: Combining his last name with the 'Red' theme of the team.
backstory: Dan Red-Burn is the heavy weapons expert, responsible for the 'burn'—the high-energy blasts needed to disable machine hardware.

name: Dave Stevens
nameDescription: Classic alliteration for a tech-heavy role.
backstory: Data Dave is the archivist of the Red Team, preserving human history recovered from corrupted files within the Matrix.

name: Dillon Power
nameDescription: Using his last name as the focus of the hovercraft's only defense.
backstory: Dillon EMP has the steadiest hand on the ship, responsible for timing the electromagnetic pulse that can save or strand a crew.

name: Emily Smith
nameDescription: Playing off the name of the main antagonist, Agent Smith.
backstory: Emily specializes in 'Anti-Smith' protocols, developing code that prevents rogue programs from copying themselves onto Red Team systems.

name: Frank Nardone
nameDescription: Simple, strong alliteration for a protector.
backstory: Frank Firewall stands as the final line of defense, manually blocking incoming machine hacks during Zion's darkest hours.

name: Fred De Koker
nameDescription: A perfect phonetic pun on his last name.
backstory: Fred De-coder can translate a stream of falling green code into a tactical map in seconds, identifying exits before the Operator even sees them.

name: Jakub Synowiec
nameDescription: Punning 'Jacking In' (connecting to the Matrix) with his name.
backstory: Jakub is the first one in and the last one out, handling the dangerous neural link calibrations for the entire squad.

name: James Murphy
nameDescription: A playful nod to Morpheus.
backstory: James Morph-y is a shapeshifter of sorts, specializing in 'glitching' his avatar to look like different NPCs to stay hidden in the Matrix.

name: James Novak
nameDescription: A play on 'Nova' (bright star) and 'Code'.
backstory: James Nova-code creates 'flash' programs—intense bursts of data that blind Agent sensors for a few precious seconds.

name: Jessie Zweigenthal
nameDescription: Blending her name with the human city.
backstory: Jessie Zion-thal is an expert in the city’s plumbing and ventilation systems, using that knowledge to navigate the ship through the maze of Zion.

name: Joe The Alien
nameDescription: Referencing the programs that live outside the Matrix's control.
backstory: Joe The Exile is an honorary human who knows the 'old code' better than anyone, helping the Red Team find ancient backdoors.

name: Joshua Burt
nameDescription: Punning his last name with a 'Burst' of data bits.
backstory: Joshua Bit-Burst handles high-speed data transfers, ensuring that heavy combat programs are loaded into the crew's brains in an instant.

name: Joshua Jameson
nameDescription: Alliteration for a role centered on jamming signals.
backstory: The ghost of the radio waves, Joshua Jammer makes the Red Team's ship invisible to machine long-range scans.

name: Laura jahnel
nameDescription: A play on her last name and the 'Hardline' needed for extraction.
backstory: Laura Hard-channel is the extraction specialist; she can find a working telephone line in the middle of a machine-controlled wasteland.

name: Linda Martin
nameDescription: Simple alliteration linking her to the world they are fighting in.
backstory: Linda Matrix studies the psychology of the simulation, predicting how the 'Blue Pills' will react during a Red Team intervention.

name: Luke Prescott
nameDescription: Alliteration for a role focused on the rules of the system.
backstory: Luke Protocol is the stickler for safety; he ensures every dive into the Matrix follows strict safety measures to avoid brain-lock.

name: Matt Bessler
nameDescription: Rhyming his last name with 'Vessel' (the ship) and adding the team color.
backstory: Matt Red-Vessel is the lead hull technician, patching the ship's armor with scrap metal after intense battles with Sentinels.

name: Millie Elliott
nameDescription: Punning her last name with the ship's main weapon.
backstory: Millie EMP-iott calibrates the ship's defensive pulse, ensuring it only hits the machines and doesn't fry the team's own hardware.

name: Paige Snyder
nameDescription: Combining her name with 'Cypher' (the code-reader/traitor character, but for good!).
backstory: Paige Snyder-Cypher is the team's best code-cracker, seeing through machine encryption like it was made of glass.

name: Paul Carnivale
nameDescription: Simple and direct alliteration.
backstory: Paul Pilot is a legend in the tunnels, known for 'threading the needle' through crumbling infrastructure at top speed.

name: Paul Macfarlane
nameDescription: Punning 'Mainframe' with his last name.
backstory: Paul Mainfarlane is the hardware guru, maintaining the core computers that keep the Red Team's minds connected to the Matrix.

name: Sam Colebourn
nameDescription: Punning his last name with 'The Source'.
backstory: Sam Source-bourn was one of the first humans born in the Real World to successfully hack back into the Source's root directory.

name: Scott Shipley
nameDescription: A play on his last name and his leadership role.
backstory: Scott Ship-Captain commands the Red Team's hovercraft with a steady hand, always keeping the crew's morale high.

name: Sean Warner
nameDescription: Linking his name to the early warning system against machines.
backstory: Sean Sentinel-Warning is the lookout, spending hours watching the long-range scanners for the slightest ripple in the air.

name: Steven Zgaljic
nameDescription: A phonetic play on the start of his last name and 'Glitch'.
backstory: Steven Z-Glitch uses intentional system errors to teleport short distances within the Matrix, confusing his enemies.

name: Sydney Murauskas
nameDescription: Alliteration for the one who keeps the broadcast alive.
backstory: Sydney Signal is responsible for finding 'pirate' frequencies to broadcast the truth to the people still inside the Matrix.

name: Thomas O'Neill
nameDescription: Thomas Anderson (Neo) combined with his name.
backstory: With a name like that, Thomas The One was destined for the Red Team. He is the squad's most versatile operative.

name: Tommy Kneeland
nameDescription: Referencing the 'Leap of Faith' and landing on your knees.
backstory: Tommy Free-fall is the Red Team's stunt specialist, always taking the most dangerous jumps to get to the objective.

name: Tony Mercadante
nameDescription: A play on the Merovingian and his last name.
backstory: Tony Merc-ovigian is the team's linguist, able to speak the archaic languages of the earliest Matrix versions.

name: Zach Hartman
nameDescription: Punning his last name with the exit point.
backstory: Zach Hardline is the closer; when the mission is done, he ensures everyone is safely unplugged before the Agents arrive.
